body: @nunobrito thanks for your comments, we definitely will review and fix our code. We're Maven users mostly, that's why..

Actually, this is a complete list of dependencies you will need (in their latest versions):

```
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.jcabi</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcabi-aspects</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.jcabi</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcabi-immutable</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.jcabi</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcabi-xml</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.jcabi</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcabi-http</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.jcabi.incubator</groupId>
            <artifactId>xembly</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.jcabi</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcabi-manifests</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.jcabi</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcabi-log</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>commons-io</groupId>
            <artifactId>commons-io</artifactId>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.commons</groupId>
            <artifactId>commons-lang3</artifactId>
        </dependency>
```

Of course, some of them may have other dependencies (so called "transitive"). I think it's not a bad idea to create a big ready-to-use JAR archive.
I'll deploy a big JAR file to Maven Central in less than an hour. It will be over 4Mb, but with all dependencies inside.

Version 0.9.2 released to Maven Central. Now you can download the entire project in one JAR file: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/jcabi/jcabi-github/0.9.2/jcabi-github-0.9.2-jar-with-dependencies.jar (will be available in 10-20 min).

Yegor, thank you very much! I just went for dinner and was thinking about parsing the text on my own when I saw your replies. Wow, just wow.

I've downloaded the fat jar and tried it out but still fails on the initialization. This is the output with the error message:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
    at core.start.main(start.java:35)
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Atribute 'JCabi-Version' not found in MANIFEST.MF file(s) among 3 other attribute(s) ["Archiver-Version", "Created-By", "Manifest-Version"] and 0 injection(s)
    at com.jcabi.manifests.Manifests.read(Manifests.java:210)
    at com.jcabi.github.RtGithub.<clinit>(RtGithub.java:82)

This same error seems to have happened before in https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/138

Thanks in advance.
that could be.. let me check again..
yes, it's a bug. will fix it now.
[Version 0.9.3](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/releases/tag/jcabi-0.9.3) fixed the problem. Try to use it and let me know if there are any other bugs. I'll be happy to fix :)

Thanks. I've downloaded the fat jar version 0.9.3 from:
http://central.maven.org/maven2/com/jcabi/jcabi-github/0.9.3/jcabi-github-0.9.3-jar-with-dependencies.jar

But now a different exception occurs:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/hamcrest/Matcher
    at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method)
    at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:2493)
    at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:2803)
    at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructor(Class.java:2053)
    at com.jcabi.http.request.DefaultResponse.as_aroundBody12(DefaultResponse.java:170)
    at com.jcabi.http.request.DefaultResponse$AjcClosure13.run(DefaultResponse.java:1)
    at org.aspectj.runtime.reflect.JoinPointImpl.proceed(JoinPointImpl.java:149)
    at com.jcabi.aspects.aj.MethodLogger.wrap(MethodLogger.java:200)
    at com.jcabi.aspects.aj.MethodLogger.ajc$inlineAccessMethod$com_jcabi_aspects_aj_MethodLogger$com_jcabi_aspects_aj_MethodLogger$wrap(MethodLogger.java:1)
    at com.jcabi.aspects.aj.MethodLogger.wrapClass(MethodLogger.java:128)
    at com.jcabi.http.request.DefaultResponse.as(DefaultResponse.java:170)
    at com.jcabi.github.RtValuePagination$Items.fetch(RtValuePagination.java:198)
    at com.jcabi.github.RtValuePagination$Items.hasNext(RtValuePagination.java:184)
    at core.start.main(start.java:37)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.hamcrest.Matcher
    at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:366)
    at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:355)
    at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
    at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:354)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:425)
    at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:308)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:358)
    ... 14 more

I then added manually the mentioned hamcrest dependency from:
http://search.maven.org/remotecontent?filepath=org/hamcrest/hamcrest-library/1.3/hamcrest-library-1.3.jar

But same result persists.

You can likely replicate these same errors when trying the fat jar without Maven support.

With kind regards,
Nuno Brito
[version 0.9.4](https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/releases/tag/jcabi-0.9.4) fixes the problem entirely. Please take a look and let me know...

Version 0.9.4 fat jar works!! :thumbsup::heavy_check_mark:

**Thank you very much**. Will now close the bug report.
Thanks for your help too. Feel free to give our project a star :)
Well deserved. Top star team and project.  :+1:
